acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 96 hours LC50=4.02mg/L of the fish (Fathead Minnows) (CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report (2004) and others.).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the LC50 value (4 hours) of 2,770ppm, calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (4-hour inhalation of vapour) of 11.7mg/L, 11.9mg/L (4 hours) (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.52 (2004), was lower than 90% of the saturated vapour concentration (6,600ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 0.67kPa (CERI Hazard Data 96-46 (1998)), the substance was considered as "vapour containing substantially no mist" and was classified based on standard values expressed in ppm.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) of 5,000mg/kg (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.52 (2004)).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May be fatal if swallowed and enters airways
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Based on the fact that styrene is a hydrocarbon and has a dynamic viscosity of 0.772 mm2/s (25degC) (CERI calculated value).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Group 2B by IARC (2002).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 100% (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and the bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=2.95 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was claasified into Not classified.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: No data available Those containing stabilizers are classified into Class 3 (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, UN#2055)

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 31degC (c.c.) (ICSC, 1999) which is classified into Category 3. Those containing stabilizers are classified into Class 3 and Packing Group III (UN#2055) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on germ cell multi-generation mutagenicity/mutagenicity tests in vivo, positive data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (chromosome aberration tests, micronucleus tests), and the absence of data on germ cell genotoxicity tests in vivo (As for positive data on DNA single-strand break analysis (No.36) of the brain, liver, kidneys, lungs and testes of a mouse, an analysis was conducted exclusively on germ cells - the results of which are considered "ambiguous" by experts.), described in ACGIH (7th, 2001) and CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.52 (2004)

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures; the auto-ignition temperature is 490degC (ICSC, 1999)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: May damage fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the description in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.52 (2004): Three-generation reproduction studies in rats suggest a decrease in the survival rates of F1 and F2 newborns at dose levels not toxic to F0; Developmental toxicity and lactational administration studies in rats suggest brain serotonin depletion, a delay in righting/auditory reflexes and many other behavioral abnormalities in offspring at dosing levels not toxic to dams.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though containing unsaturated bonds. Those containing stabilizers are classified into Class 3 (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, UN#2055)

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on human epidemiological studies and rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.52 (2004): "moderate irritation (for seven days)."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of "moderate irritation" from rabbit skin irritation tests.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (respiratory system, nervous system, blood system, liver)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (respiratory system, nervous system, blood system, liver)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "valid conclusions can be drawn neither from human cases nor from epidemiological studies because the unknown amount of exposure and the possibility of multiple exposure involving other substances" "Styrene causes 1) irritation to the eyes, skin, nose and larynx, 2) respiratory effects such as obstructive pulmonary disease and chronic bronchitis, 3) dizziness, headache, exhaustion and confusion, 4) adverse effects on the central nervous system (insomnia), the mental/nervous function (a delay in reaction time, debilitating linguistic memory, etc.), the visual and auditory senses, the blood systems (an increase in lymphocyte count, a decrease in platelet count, etc.) and the liver (an increase in AST/GGT/ALT activity, etc.)" described in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.52 (2004). There is also a description in CERI-NITE Hazard Assessment No.52 (2004) of the evidence from animal studies including "vacuolation of the epidermal cells of the nasal/tunica mucous membrane, exfoliated cells, pyknosis, a decrease in SVC (sensory nerve conduction velocity), hepatocyte necrosis."

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification:
Category 1 (central nervous system),
Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
Causes damage to organs (central nervous system)
May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "eye/nose irritation, effects on the central nervous systems" (EHC 26 (1993)), (CERI Hazard Data 96-46 (1998)).
